PrimEcoSys: Southern California Oak Woodland and Savanna

habitat_description:
The distribution of this lizard extends from southern California well into Baja California Sur, but excluding the San Felipe Desert region of northeastern Baja California. Populations also occur in the Pacific Islands of Isla de Cedros, Isla Magdalena, and Isla Margarita (Grismer 2002; McGuire 1996; Stebbins 2003).

The habitats occupied by this lizard include sparsely vegetated flats of the Vizcaino Peninsula, but also in densely vegetated chaparral in southern California. Also in arroyo bottoms, open sandy flats, bajadas, coastal sage scrub, creosote bush scrub, and oak woodland areas (Grismer 2002; McGuire 1996).

Found commonly moving about among clumps of vegetation, basking on roadside rocks, dirt roads. It occurs in creosote bush scrub habitats, coastal sage scrub, and oak woodland habitats.  Plants includes chamise, California buckwheat, Great Basin sage, scrub oak, white sage,  sugarbrush, laurel sumac, prickly pear and cholla cacti.
